I have a scheduling conflict between two mandatory courses on the same day. What do you recommend?
retrieved_data: CACHE_FILE: course_index_cache.json
Relevant PDF: Advising notes suggest contacting the registrar when conflicts arise, as rescheduling might be possible.
Course Info: Conflicts in core scheduling may require administrative intervention.
I recommend reaching out to the registrar’s office or your academic advisor as soon as possible. They can help you adjust your schedule or find alternative sections to resolve the conflict.

What thesis requirements do I still need to complete?
retrieved_data: CACHE_FILE: course_index_cache.json

Relevant PDF: The audit report lists the following thesis requirements as still needed: Comprehensive Oral Exam (COMO), Thesis Defense (DEFN), Draft Thesis submission (DRAT), Format Approval Sheet (FORM), Final Thesis submission (THES), Signed Thesis Title Page (TITL), and ETD Submission Form (ETDF). Additionally, you must apply to graduate and be enrolled in the semester of graduation.
PDF Excerpts:
"Comprehensive Oral Exam: Still needed
Thesis Defense: Still needed
Draft Thesis: Still needed
Format Approval Sheet: Still needed
Final Thesis: Still needed
Signed Thesis Title Page: Still needed
ETD Submission Form: Still needed
Applied to Graduate: Still needed
Enrolled in Semester of Graduation: Still needed"

According to your audit, you still need to complete the following for your thesis: pass the Comprehensive Oral Exam, pass the Thesis Defense, submit your Draft Thesis along with a Format Approval Sheet, and then submit your Final Thesis with a Signed Thesis Title Page and the ETD Submission Form. Also, remember to apply to graduate and enroll in your graduation semester.
academic advisor
I’ve completed all my core requirements but still have several elective credits pending. How do I determine which electives to choose?
retrieved_data: CACHE_FILE: course_index_cache.json

Course Info: Electives should complement your core courses and personal interests.

Since you've finished your core requirements, choose electives that align with your career goals and interests while also filling any remaining credit gaps. It might be helpful to discuss your options with your academic advisor for personalized advice.

What happens if I take less than 9 credit hours in a semester?
retrieved_data: CACHE_FILE: course_index_cache.json
Relevant PDF: Advising information stresses that full-time status requires at least 9 credit hours.
JSON Excerpts:
{"full_time": {"min": 9}}
Course Info: Falling below 9 credit hours can jeopardize full-time status and impact visa eligibility for international students.

If you take fewer than 9 credit hours, you won't be considered a full-time student. This could affect both your academic progress and, for international students, your visa status, so it's best to stay above that minimum.
